owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the `.git` extension. The name is not case sensitive.

state.description: Set to `open` or `resolved` to only list secret scanning alerts in a specific state.

secret_type.description: A comma-separated list of secret types to return. All default secret patterns are returned. To return generic patterns, pass the token name(s) in the parameter. See "[Supported secret scanning patterns](https://docs.github.com/code-security/secret-scanning/introduction/supported-secret-scanning-patterns#supported-secrets)" for a complete list of secret types.

resolution.description: A comma-separated list of resolutions. Only secret scanning alerts with one of these resolutions are listed. Valid resolutions are `false_positive`, `wont_fix`, `revoked`, `pattern_edited`, `pattern_deleted` or `used_in_tests`.

sort.description: The property to sort the results by. `created` means when the alert was created. `updated` means when the alert was updated or resolved.

direction.description: The direction to sort the results by.

page.description: The page number of the results to fetch. For more information, see "[Using pagination in the REST API](https://docs.github.com/rest/using-the-rest-api/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api)."

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100). For more information, see "[Using pagination in the REST API](https://docs.github.com/rest/using-the-rest-api/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api)."

before.description: A cursor, as given in the [Link header](https://docs.github.com/rest/guides/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api#using-link-headers). If specified, the query only searches for events before this cursor. To receive an initial cursor on your first request, include an empty "before" query string.

after.description: A cursor, as given in the [Link header](https://docs.github.com/rest/guides/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api#using-link-headers). If specified, the query only searches for events after this cursor.  To receive an initial cursor on your first request, include an empty "after" query string.

validity.description: A comma-separated list of validities that, when present, will return alerts that match the validities in this list. Valid options are `active`, `inactive`, and `unknown`.

is_publicly_leaked.description: A boolean value representing whether or not to filter alerts by the publicly-leaked tag being present.

is_multi_repo.description: A boolean value representing whether or not to filter alerts by the multi-repo tag being present.
